Tha An Comunn Gaidhealach a’ bruidhinn air Seanaileir ùr a thaghadh a bhios os cionn obair a’ Chomuinn. [...] Cha b’ fhuilear do dhuine de ’n t-seòrsa so tomhas mhath de chumhachd a bhith aige. Cha dean math dha a bhith air a shlaodadh aig tòin Coimitidh, ach feumaidh an Coimitidh earbsa a bhith aca ás. [...] Bhiodh a leòr aige ri dhèanamh an toiseach ag ath-nuadhachadh dreach a’ Chomuinn. [...] Ach dh’ fheumadh am Fear-stiùiridh ùr barrachd air a sin a dhèanamh. Dh’ fheumadh e siubhal a dhèanamh eadar Rubha Robhanais agus Ceann Bharraidh, eadar am Parbh is Maol Chinn-tìre, agus cha deanadh math dha dìochuimhneachadh gu robh obair a’ Chomuinn a’ buntainn ri Coimisean nan Croitearan an Inbhirnis, ri Roinn an Fhoghluim an Dùn-Eideann, agus ri Tigh nan Cumantan an Lunnainn.
The Highland Society is talking about choosing a new General who will oversee the Society’s work. [...] A person of this kind would have to have a good measure of power. It would do him no good to be dragged along by the Committee ??, but the Committee must have trust in him. [...] He would have enough to do initially reforming the Society. [...] But the new leader would have to do more than (just) that. He would have to travel between the Butt of Lewis and Barra Head, between Cape Wrath and the Mull of Kintyre, and he should not forget that the Society’s work is related to the Crofters’ Commission in Inverness, to the Education Department in Edinburgh, and to the House of Commons in London. td. 105, ‘Air an Spiris’

Bha grunnan de ar luchd-leughaidh an dùil, nuair a nochd an àireamh mu dheireadh de Ghairm, gu robh sin a’ strì ri buidheann shònraichte, no duine sònraichte, a chur do ’n Phàrlamaid, agus bha wèireichean an telefon gu math teth, uair no dhà, an déidh dhuinn tighinn o ’n chlò. Thog iad ceàrr sinn.
Some of our readers were expecting [?], when the last issue of Gairm appeared, that that was striving to send a particular group [party?], or a particular person, to the Parliament, and the telephone wires were pretty hot, for an hour or two [once or twice?], after we came from the printers. They misunderstood us. td. 9, ‘Air an Spiris’
